title: Ticket #3894: condor_config_val -dump should work remotely
description:
Add to daemon core the ability to query the names of all configuration knobs, and add to condor_config_val the ability to use that to provide the functionality of 

    condor_config_val -<daemon> [-dump|-verbose]

where <daemon> is master, startd, etc.

Current daemons already support the DC_CONFIG_VAL function, but only condor_who uses it - condor_config_val does not. This gives us the oppotunity to extend the behavior of DC_CONFIG_VAL so support more complex queries by using characters not allowed in param names. And to return more than a single string result back.

The DC_CONFIG_VAL command will be extended to look for ? in the first character position of the input argument. If it exists, what follows will be a command rather than a parameter name. Initially, the supported commands will be

  • ?names[:<regex>] - return all of the param names. Optionally return all of the names that match the given regex.

Additionally, the normal DC_CONFIG_VAL query, which passes a single param name, will now return multiple strings in the following order. HTCondor daemons prior to 8.1.2 will return only the first line, so clients of the DC_CONFIG_VAL command must be prepared to deal with getting back either 1 string or an arbitrary number of strings - future versions of daemon core may return more additional strings after <default-value> 

<expanded-value>
<name> = <raw-value> (like the line would appear in the config file)
<source>[, line <lineno>]
<default-value>

where <source> can be a filename, or <Detected>, <Default>, <Environment>, <Over>, or <Internal>.

condor_config_val will be enhanced to make use of the expanded return values of DC_CONFIG_VAL and of the new ?names query to add support for -dump and and -verbose modes for remote queries.
